title: Debussy: Douze Etudes - Mitsuko Uchida (1990)
description:
Gramophone [8/1999]:
"Uchida's Gramophone Award-winning Debussy Etudes, rapturously acclaimed by DJF and others in these pages, hardly need a further plug from me. Hers is nerve-end playing of surpassing fantasy and refinement, minutely responsive to texture and colour. Listen, for instance, to the canto dolce marcato in â€˜Pour les tierces', etched with infinite delicacy (from 1'37''), or the torrent of sound she conjures in the closing bars; to the shimmering calm of the dolce e sostenuto opening of â€˜Pour les sixtes'; the gossamer lightness of the following â€˜Pour les huit doigts'; the airborne, scherzando grace â€“ and freedom from the bar-line â€“ of â€˜Pour les notes repetees'; and the combination of incisiveness and elasticity in the final â€˜Pour les accords'. Uchida's virtuosity and elan are stunning, her tonal shading, especially in the softer dynamics, verging on the miraculous. As DJF remarked in his original review, these are readings that expand notions of Debussian style. The recording is exemplary in its clarity and warmth." --Richard Wigmore (from the review of Great Pianists of the 20th Century - Mitsuko Uchida)
